What is your opinion on the Latter Rain movement? Have you heard of it?

The Latter Rain movement is apparently an offshoot of a revival movement(for lack of a better term) which I was born into. (I found this out today! I'd thought I had been born into the Latter Rain, while it seems that the particular group I'm involved with is somewhat different.) 
 
 Basically, in 1948, there was a revival at North Battleford, Saskatchewan, Canada. It is apparently quite well-known, more than I'd expected, considering the number of related web-sites I found. Anyhow if you're curious, a monthly newsletter The Sharon Star can be found here: http://thesharonstar.org/
 
 Anyone interested, please read a few articles. The site also has a short statement of our beliefs. I couldn't find anything else about my particular group, althought their is plenty about the Latter Rain movement.
 
 What I want to know is if you would consider our beleifs heresey or blasphemous. It seems to be the main opinion, judging by web sites, that the Latter Rain movement is feared and criticized, but they are different from us.

The Latter Rain movement is apparently an offshoot of a revival movement(for lack of a better term) which I was born into. (I found this out today! I'd thought I had been born into the Latter Rain, while it seems that the particular group I'm involved with is somewhat different.) 
 
 Basically, in 1948, there was a revival at North Battleford, Saskatchewan, Canada. It is apparently quite well-known, more than I'd expected, considering the number of related web-sites I found. Anyhow if you're curious, a monthly newsletter The Sharon Star can be found here: http://thesharonstar.org/
 
 Anyone interested, please read a few articles. The site also has a short statement of our beliefs. I couldn't find anything else about my particular group, althought their is plenty about the Latter Rain movement.
 
 What I want to know is if you would consider our beleifs heresey or blasphemous. It seems to be the main opinion, judging by web sites, that the Latter Rain movement is feared and criticized, but they are different from us.

 
 I do not see anything heretical in their statement of faith. I have a problem with the doctrine that everyone must be able to speak in tongues.
Thanks for answering. I can't speak in tounges myself.
The beliefs seem pretty mainstream Christian. I am curious to know what an apostolic elder is.

They are basically the leaders of the church. I believe they are patterned after the Apostles of the early church. Our leaders aren't paid, like pastors, they have jobs apart from the church - although I'm not certain about the Apostolic Elders.

They are basically the leaders of the church. I believe they are patterned after the Apostles of the early church. Our leaders aren't paid, like pastors, they have jobs apart from the church - although I'm not certain about the Apostolic Elders.

 
 My church is also an elder led church, not a pastor led church. Qualifications of an elder are in titus and timothy. 
 
 I too am uncertain as to the definition of apostolic elder. 
 
 The doctrine does seem mostly mainstream christian, although I am inclined to see this as a "church of God Holiness" denomination. I think it may be on the same order as the assemblies of God but the tongues thing is an indication of a slightly more "evangelical" church.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Latter Rain
